metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1283 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The pcre_compile2 function in pcre_compile.c in PCRE 8.38 mishandles the /((?:F?+(?:^(?(R)a+\"){99}-))(?J)(?'R'(?'R'<((?'RR'(?'R'\){97)?J)?J)(?'R'(?'R'\){99|(:(?|(?'R')(\k'R')|((?'R')))H'R'R)(H'R))))))/ pattern and related patterns with named subgroups, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted regular expression, as demonstrated by a JavaScript RegExp object encountered by Konqueror.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre16-3 - 2:8.38-3.1
libpcre3 - 2:8.38-3.1
libpcre32-3 - 2:8.38-3.1
libpcrecpp0v5 - 2:8.38-3.1
pcregrep - 2:8.38-3.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced in 8.34 ebarretto> pcre2 not affected as vulnerable code is not present

criterions.comment: pcre3 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:8.38-3.1').
